title: Use of Force Policy (Lowndes County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Use of Force Policy (Lowndes County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All policies, practices, procedures, rules, or orders concerning the use of force.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blake Feldman

communications.subject: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
I am in receipt of your request for policies on the Use of Force from the Lowndes County Sheriff's Office.  Your records are ready and available for pickup.  The records production for a paper copy will be $3.00 and a CD will be $10.00 payable by Cashier's Check.  If postage is required, it will be an additional $10.00 to cover for shipping and handling.  Your request is considered complete and awaiting payment prior to being delivered.

Brent Swan

If we mail the CD, the cost is $10.00.  The total for paper copies mailed will be $5.50.  Once payment is received, your documents will mail within 24 hours on weekdays.

title: Institutional Press Policies (University of Alabama at Birmingham)

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Institutional Press Policies (University of Alabama at Birmingham)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Anne Marie Tamburro.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any FBI files on Daniel Ellsberg. Born April 7, 1931 in Chicago, Illinois, Daniel Ellsberg died June 16, 2023 in Kensington, California. He was America's most famous whistleblower. His death at age 92 was widely reported in the media in June, 2023. He was the husband of the American journalist Patricia Marx Ellsberg. He is also known by the name Dan Ellsberg.

Records relating to or mentioning Daniel Ellsberg. Major media outlets across America as of June 16th, 2023 have reported his death including: https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2023/06/16/daniel-ellsberg-pentagon-papers-dead/ https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/16/us/daniel-ellsberg-dead.html

Please conduct searches of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the SENTINEL system, FBI email system, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, Counter-drug Information Indices System (CIIS), Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW) including but not limited to Investigative Data Warehouse - Secret, IDW-S Core, SPT, and DOCLAB-S, FBI Automated Case Support system (ACS), subset of the Electronic Case File (ECF) system, National Crime Information Center (NCIC), Combined DNA Index System (CODIS), Integrated Automated Fingerprint Identification System (IAFIS), Interstate Photo System (IPS) and/or Facial Recognition Databases such as those used by FACE (Facial Analysis, Comparison, and Evaluation) specialists, and the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA) warrant applications and/or Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court (FISC) record filings, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please further consult all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other data sources containing potentially-responsive materials related to Daniel Ellsberg.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, investigations, inquiries, audio files, photographs or image files, video files, memos, email systems, directives, network packet captures, meeting minute notes, calendar entries, and any other data or data format that is used by the FBI. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, code names, nicknames, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency or any other agency that is known to the FBI. Please additionally include searches for inter-agency or non-agency communications accessible by the FBI about Daniel Ellsberg.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

It is my understanding that your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, which remain technically under your agency’s control (see 36 CFR 1250.8). Please also conduct a search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for records related to Daniel Ellsberg.

Furthermore, I request the FOIA log and copies of all other requests for information on Daniel Ellsberg including the responsive documents.

Daniel Ellsberg was a public figure. This request is a critical part of a journalistic research project which requires the responsive documents for informing the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Appelbaum

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596215-000
communications.communication:
Hello,

I am writing to follow up on recent communication regarding my FOIA request regarding Dr. Daniel Ellsberg.

Thank you for sending copies of previously released information about Dr. Daniel Ellsberg in partial fulfillment of FOIPA Request No.: 1596215-000. I see that in the reply that contains these previously released documents, additional records that are responsive to my request exist. I am writing to confirm within the allotted thirty day window that this material does not satisfy my request as most of the documents are more than forty years old, and many are much older. I understand that Dr. Daniel Ellsberg continued to be of interest to the FBI long after the early 1980s. I request that the additional records about my requested subject be processed.

Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596215-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former U.S. military analyst Daniel Ellsberg (April 7, 1931 – June 16, 2023). His death is widely-known and has been widely reported, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. You may find an obituary from NBC News attached below, and a statement by Mr. Ellsberg's son at the following link: https://twitter.com/RobertEllsberg/status/1669776046751899648

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

    https://twitter.com/RobertEllsberg/status/1669776046751899648
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not
    limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone

    the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and
    cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant
    names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not

    cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any
    information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to
    137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files.
    
    If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to
    review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of
    responsive documents, as the FOIA requires
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look

    Sincerely,
    
    Matthew Petti
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/MatthewPetti_RNucinGD/123240/Daniel_Ellsberg_Pentagon_Papers_whistleblower_dies_at_92_compressed.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fdaniel-ellsberg-147863%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2NfVNjHDTE1Gy_ueXvgrmh4%3A1qB4lf%3AMgOsMtOLjYb5f8AKSEItMIzpnmevTAqBy9sl7GRmrP8

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596242-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for this partial response. In your letter, you write:

"Please be advised that additional records responsive to your subject exist. If this release of previously processed material does not satisfy your request, you must advise us that you want the additional records processed."

I would like to formally advise that I would like the additional records processed. Please confirm receipt of my request. Thank you again for your prompt attention to this matter.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596242-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Incident Reports Involving Squeegee Workers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning incidents involving squeegee workers within the city of Baltimore, particularly those occurring near major intersections and thoroughfares, for the period of January 2022 to November 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

 I am a student at Tulane University conducting research. 

Sincerely,

Meghan Green
Mgreen16@tulane.edu

communications.subject: Acknowledgement MPIA 23-3052
communications.communication:
Dear Meghan Green:

This is an acknowledgement of your request below, for public information, submitted to the Document Compliance Unit (“DCU”) of the Baltimore Police Department (“BPD”).  Your request is governed by the Maryland Public Information Act (“PIA”), Maryland Code, General Provisions Article (“GP”), Sections 4-101 et seq.  DCU will process your request promptly.  However, our response may take longer than ten (10) working days, the reasons for which may include the scope of your request, the type and volume of potentially responsive records, and the nature of the search, review, and preparation that is required.  In any event, DCU will respond to your request within thirty (30) days. GP § 4-203.

DCU will contact you with the availability of records and the possible costs associated with this request, as soon as the information is made available by the Custodian of Records.  Likewise, if DCU and/or the Custodian of Records need you to clarify your request, DCU will contact you promptly.
Your request has been assigned to Julie Hallam.  The DCU staff receive overwhelming number of requests a month and we are working diligently to respond to each and every request as quickly as possible. We appreciate your patience; response to document requests may take longer than normal.

Please refer to tracking # MPIA  23-3052 in any subsequent correspondence pertaining to this matter.  All follow up correspondence should be made in writing and submitted to the DCU’s e-mail: DCU@baltimorepolice.org<mailto:DCU@baltimorepolice.org>.



DCU

BPD

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request #MPIA 23-3052
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Maryland Public Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 28, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #MPIA 23-3052.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: MPIA 23-3052
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Ms. Green,

On November 28, 2023, you submitted a request for public records to the Document Compliance Unit ("DCU") of the Baltimore Police Department ("BPD"), for:

"Records relating to or mentioning incidents involving squeegee workers within the city of Baltimore, particularly those occurring near major intersections and thoroughfares, for the period of January 2022 to November 2023."

The Maryland Public Information Act ("PIA"), Annotated Code of Maryland, General Provisions Article, § 4-101, et seq. governs your request. The responsive record(s) are maintained by the Document Compliance Unit, DCU of BPD.

Attached are the CAD and Calls for Service (CFS) for the dates requested January 2022 to November 2023 "involving squeegee workers within the city of Baltimore".

Nothing in this response is intended to indicate that any records sought from BPD exist or to waive any privileges held by BPD. You have a right under the Public Information Act for the Public Access Ombudsman to mediate any disputes arising out of a MPIA request or a judicial review pursuant to General Provisions Article §§ 4-1B-04, 4-362. Please refer to Tracking Number # MPIA 23-3052. in any subsequent correspondence in this matter.


[cid:image001.png@01DA1886.8CD5B130]<http://www.baltimorecity.gov/>
Baltimore Police

Niki Gills
Investigative Specialist
Document Compliance Unit
601 E. Fayette Street
Baltimore, MD  21202
Nichola.gills@baltimorepolice.org<mailto:Nichola.gills@baltimorepolice.org>

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Call Records For NorthCom
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please furnish the incoming and outgoing call records from the dispatch center on the date of 12.5.2023 for the phone number 561-320-7690, please include the incoming caller ID, who answered the phone, their name and ID number and the recordings of the calls.

There should be no feed associated with this request. I would ask that this request be filled via email per Florida Sunshine Law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mason C. Turner

Total Estimate: $ 17.00

 Request Number: Police-3600-2023 
  
 Due to the high volume of requests being processed, your request may take up to seven business days to complete from the date of payment. 
  
 The Palm Beach Gardens Police Department releases all digital media electronically, by a link that will be sent via email from Evidence.com. 
  
 Please note, if applicable, the body camera videos will be redacted per F.S. 119.071. 
  
 Feel free to contact me with any questions.

title: Request to NASA for 2016-2020 film collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to NASA for 2016-2020 film collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the years 2016-2020. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Sincerely,

communications.communication:
Dear Brett  Carollo, 

Your request was received by NASA Public Access Link. The request was assigned tracking #24-00229-F-HQ. You seek the following: 

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:A list of all the films that the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the years 2016-2020. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. (Date Range for Record Search: From 1/1/2016 To 12/31/2020) 

Please log into your account and review your submission. The application address is https://pal.hq.nasa.gov/. 

Thank you, 
NASA Public Access Link

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00229-F-HQ
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Moore,

Thank you for releasing the Space Act Agreements for these three films. Note that I requested info on all films that NASA participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, between 2016 and 2020. Am I to assume that, during  this period, NASA only signed such agreements with three productions? If there are additional Space Act Agreements with other productions during this period, I would appreciate those as well.

Attached is a list from NASA of entertainment industry productions supported for the years 2006-2015. A similar list for the years 2017-2020 would be appreciated. 

Thank you for your time,

Brett Carollo

Thank you,

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Brett,

10 a.m. Thursday works for me. Just as a heads up my number sometimes shows up in caller IDs as either “unavailable” or “unknown.” I’ll be calling from my work phone number below (202-358-2681).
Thanks,

Derek Moore
Government Information Specialist
NASA Headquarters, FOIA
202-358-2681

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00229-F-HQ
communications.communication:
Good Morning Brett,

Thank you for the call a short time ago.

We talked about the Space Act Agreements sent with this request as our response to you seeking a list of films. In our records search Bert Ulrich identified the films corresponding to each Space Act Agreement (SAA) as being the only movies NASA collaborated with, and provided the agreements as part of the list. I apologize for not explaining this more clearly and also not explaining that those SAAs for each movie is a complete list of movies for the time period specified in the request.

I also mentioned NASA’s Records Retention Schedule, which is available at following web address: https://nodis3.gsfc.nasa.gov/NPR_attachments/NRRS_1441.1.pdf. If permanent records exist they may have been sent to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) in accordance with the Federal Records Act and NASA Records Record Retention Schedule. NARA’s contact is available at the following website: https://www.archives.gov/foia/contacts.html.

We also talked about NASA points of contact who have their email and phone numbers listed online for media outlets and media researchers. You can find those contacts at the following website (some have email addresses and phone numbers listed) : https://www.nasa.gov/news/media-contacts/.

Hopefully this information is helpful. Let me know if you have any other questions about this FOIA request which I can assist.

Thank you,
Derek Moore

title: Number of CityKey cards issued, September through November 2023

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Number of CityKey cards issued, September through November 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

records sufficient to show the number of CityKey cards issued per month between September 2023 through November 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grants

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grants
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Kemp's office on June 8, 2023, the Governor's office awarded more than $83.5 million in grants for 118 qualified projects as part of the Community Public Safety Grant program. This included a total of four grants to the Doraville Police Department described in additional documents provided by the Governor: https://gov.georgia.gov/press-releases/2023-06-08/gov-kemp-announces-835m-community-public-safety-grant-awards#:~:text=In%20accordance%20with%20grant%20requirements,violence%20resulting%20from%20the%20pandemic.

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents from the "Community Public Safety Grant" program for the funds received by the LaGrange Police Department as described in the Governor's press release and additional documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

title: Sacramento Complaints/Settlements Related to the 2020 Protests

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Sacramento Complaints/Settlements Related to the 2020 Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of lawsuits that details police misconduct brought against the city's police officers and/or the department by civilians or protesters who were injured during the 2020 George Floyd Protests from May 2020 to December 2021.

Copies of settlements that details the amount that plaintiffs who were injured by police during the 2020 George Floyd Protests received.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brianna Knibbs

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of Sacramento public records request #23-4371
communications.communication:
City of Sacramento ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-4371: Dear Brianna Knibbs: This email is in response to your Public Records Act request for City of Sacramento settlements which are available in the City of Sacramento's Online Records Library. City of Sacramento Settlements from 2015 to current can be located in the online records library Instructions to search the search for settlements in the online records library: * Under Document Category select City Contract in the drop down menu * Under Contract Document Type select Settlements in the drop down menu * Adjust your date range (if desired) or you can search by all settlements if you do not select a date range The City anticipates that more records will become available on or before December 14, 2023. Thank you, Melanie Haage ​ Office of the City Clerk City of Sacramento 915 I Street, 5th Floor New City Hall Sacramento, CA 95814 ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: IAPro internal investigations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the listing of internal investigations in IA Pro with columns:
 Occurred date    Case/CAD/Incident No    Employee ID/Serial number    First name    Last name    Date hired    Incident type    Directive    Finding    Finding date    Action taken    Employee Type 

I request the listing be provided in Excel format so I can easily sort/filter it. Redactions should be done in Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Las Vegas Metro PD Budget Justification Doscuments 2019/20

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Las Vegas Metro PD Budget Justification Doscuments 2019/20
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please attach any document related to the justification of the 2019-2020 annual budget. This to include any presentations to Las Vegas City or Clark County commissions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Roger Pharr

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Records About Dave Foreman
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552 et seq., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into William David Foreman, also known as David Foreman or Dave Foreman. Mr. Foreman was a prominent environmental activist for over four decades and was co-founder of the organizations Earth First! and the Rewilding Institute as well as the founding publisher of the Earth First Journal.

Mr. Foreman was born on Oct. 18, 1946, in Albuquerque and died on Sept. 19, 2022, in Albuquerque. Specific proof of death is not required as Mr. Foreman’s death has been widely publicized. This is a link to his obituary published in The New York Times: https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/28/us/david-foreman-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release. For this request, the term “all records” refers to, but is not limited to, any and all documents, correspondence (including, but not limited to, inter and/or intra-agency correspondence as well as correspondence with entities or individuals outside the federal government such as the subject and/or his affiliates, agents, contractors, representatives or lawyers), emails, letters, notes, audio or video recordings, telephone records, voicemails, telephone notes, telephone logs, text messages, chat messages, minutes, memoranda, comments, files, presentations, consultations, assessments, evaluations, schedules, papers published and/or unpublished, reports, studies, photographs and other images, and/or all other responsive records, in draft or final form.  This includes all attachments and/or linked documents noted in the responsive records.

I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. §552(a)(4)(A)(iii). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press, and is made in the process of news gathering. The responsive records will also be provided to nonprofit public interest environmental organizations. As the requester, I am a qualified researcher with a nonprofit environmental organization, and will release and share the records in order to inform the public about Mr. Foreman’s work and activities and to contribute to the public’s understanding of the operations and actions of a government agency. This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that a fee waiver is not granted and there are fees as a result, I would appreciate if you would inform me of the estimated charges to receive the records in advance, if the estimated cost is expected to be more than $25.00.

It is unlikely that any of the responsive records will be exempt from disclosure, as FOIA exemptions must be identified, applied narrowly, and justified by the agency in light of the particular exemption as applied. However, if you determine that responsive records are exempt from disclosure, please separate the exempt portions from the nonexempt portions and release the nonexempt portions. For any records that you determine to be exempt from release, please provide a specific description of the agency record or portion of the record along with a particularized description of the legal basis for withholding it and the FOIA-recognized harm that the agency believes would warrant the withholding. 

I prefer to receive the responsive records electronically, if possible, by electronic download from a website, by attachment to email, or by CD or thumbnail digital storage. If the responsive records are not available electronically, then I request that you mail copies to me using the contact information below.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Thurston

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the
    public interest, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. Â§552(a)(4)(A)(iii). The requested
    documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as
    part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a
    representative of the news media/press, and is made in the process of news
    gathering. The responsive records will also be provided to nonprofit public
    interest environmental organizations. As the requester, I am a qualified
    researcher with a nonprofit environmental organization, and will release and
    share the records in order to inform the public about Mr. Foremanâ€™s work and
    activities and to contribute to the publicâ€™s understanding of the operations
    and actions of a government agency. This request is not being made for
    commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that a fee waiver is not granted and there are fees as a
    result, I would appreciate if you would inform me of the estimated charges
    to receive the records in advance, if the estimated cost is expected to be
    more than $25.00.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    Please See attachment for description.

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Complaints or harassment?
communications.communication:
Hi Ms. Bunting,

Section 6253 of the Government Code, which sets forth the 10-day compliance period under the Public Records Act, states that a response shall be made “within 10 days from receipt of the request.”  In general, when a statute does not specifically provide for “business” days, calendar days apply.  With respect to when the 10 days begins to run, California Code of Civil Procedure section 12 provides that the “time in which any act provided by law is to be done is computed by excluding the first day and including the last, unless the last day is a holiday, and then it is also excluded.”

Thus, the 10 day period for response to a PRA request would begin the day after receipt of the PRA request.  For example, if an agency received a PRA request on Monday, September 25, the 10 day period would begin on Tuesday, September 26 and expire on Thursday, October 5.

Do you need more time?

Molly

communications.subject: Re: California Public Records Act Request: Complaints or harassment?

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Child care provider data 2019-present (Department Of Children And Families)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
1) Provider name or ID
2) Provider address
3) Latest license issue date and expiration date 
4) First license issue date
5) Enrollment, including dates on which enrollment was recorded (by child age groups if available)
6) Capacity, including dates on which capacity was recorded (by child age groups if available)
7) Prices, including dates on which prices were recorded (by child age groups if available)
8) Quality Rating and Improvement System (QRIS) scores, including dates on which scores were recorded
9) Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: Open records request Pepin
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Pepin,

I am responding to the public records request that you submitted on December 1, 2023, for the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
1) Provider name or ID
2) Provider address
3) Latest license issue date and expiration date
4) First license issue date
5) Enrollment, including dates on which enrollment was recorded (by child age groups if available)
6) Capacity, including dates on which capacity was recorded (by child age groups if available)
7) Prices, including dates on which prices were recorded (by child age groups if available)
8) Quality Rating and Improvement System (QRIS) scores, including dates on which scores were recorded
9) Any additional provider data that your agency collects

Attached please find a spreadsheet containing records that are responsive to your request, except for enrollment, price, and any additional provider data. I have not made any redactions or deletions to these records.

The Department of Children and Families (DCF) does not collect enrollment or price data from child care providers; therefore, DCF does not possess any records that are responsive to these requests.
Your last request for "[a]ny additional provider data that your agency collects" is denied as not sufficiently limited as to subject matter, as required by Wis. Stat. § 19.35(1)(h).If you would like to submit a more limited version of your last request, you may email it to dcfrecordsrequest@wisconsin.gov<mailto:dcfrecordsrequest@wisconsin.gov>.

Partial denial for your request is subject to review in an action for mandamus under Wis. Stat. § 19.37(1), or by application to the location district attorney or Attorney General. Wis. Stat. § 19.35(4)(b).
Please contact me if you have any questions.

Sincerely,
Joey Roeth
Attorney

communications.subject: PRA Request :: P013241-092823
communications.communication:
Dear Christa Miller: The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/  The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt.  Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.). 
 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 9/28/2023 and given the reference number P013241-092823 for tracking purposes. 
 
Records Requested: "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Personnel records limited to all training and professional development received by the following LBPD investigators:

- D. Goodman #5311
- S. Lasch #5451
- P. Lyon #5889
- B. Anguiano #5945

Please limit these records to training received between January 1, 2009 and January 1, 2014, to include records of training received through CA POST ICI, private training companies, conferences, or other training provider not listed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christa Miller

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flong-beach-police-department-619%252Ftraining-professional-development-records-152561%252F%253Femail%253Dlongbeachcapd%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAbwqaErL8xy5Q54U7Mg3DWRZI%3A1qm39q%3ArnWZfZbT4ZyDy4g6sDuy8ZfMMyNrxL5ZS0dxBkVs0Yk" 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Long Beach Police Department Request Center.

communications.communication:

Dear Christa Miller, The Long Beach Police Department has determined that responsive records exist and will be disclosed. We are currently working on retrieving, compiling and reviewing responsive documents and will produce as promptly as possible. Upon completion, we will send you another email notification. Thank you.

Christa Miller

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Cell Phone Notes/Records Amy Heavlin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any documents stored on any government cellular phone.  To include detailed phone records of all incoming/outgoing phone numbers and any incoming/outgoing SMS/Text messages.  Also all notes and documents stored on any personal phones and/or electronic devices that have been used to promulgate public business including SMS/Text messages, documents, and notes.  Also a copy of all public records requests sent to the City Clerk written or via email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

John Passmore

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Cell Phone Notes/Records Amy Heavlin PRR 2023-117
communications.communication:
The City of DeFuniak Springs is in receipt of
your Public Records Request via email on 12/6/2023 and will be processed in
accordance with the Florida Public Records Law under Chapter 119, F.S. You
requested “Florida Sunshine Law Request: Cell Phone Notes/Records Amy
Heavlin”.



For future reference your request will be tracked as PRR #2023 - 117.
Please reference this number when corresponding with our office.  If the
search is over a thirty-minute time frame, you will be advised of an
estimated cost of the request, reference Chapter 119.07(4) and Resolution
2018-19.  If a fee is required, payment will be due in advance by cash,
check, or money order made payable to the City of DeFuniak Springs. If the
city does not receive a reply within thirty days of providing a Cost
Estimate, the request will be considered inactive.



After review of your request, it will either be sent to you via this email
address, or you will be informed of any cost related to the request.





*Koby Townsend*



Executive Assistant

City of DeFuniak Springs

1350 Baldwin Avenue (P.O. Box 685)

DeFuniak Springs, Florida 32435



Phone (850) 892-8500 X 1104

Fax (850) 892-8570

www.defuniaksprings.net



NOTICE:  Email communications to or from The City of DeFuniak Springs are
considered to be public records.  Florida's public records law requires
these communications be made available to the public and media upon
request.  If you do not want your email address released pursuant to a
public records request, please do not send electronic mail to this
entity.   If you have received this communication in error, please notify
the sender by email at the address shown.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Electronic Monitoring DOC Data Request
communications.communication:
Dear Department Of Correction Records Access Officer:
Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:
1. All existing monthly, quarterly, and annual reports or other records that indicate the number of people within DOC custody (including DOC pre-release and/or home confinement) who are subject to electronic monitoring (by which we mean GPS or ankle bracelet monitoring, hereinafter referred to as “ELMO”) from January 1, 2019 to the time when this request is answered. We are interested in records that indicate the average length of time an individual is on ELMO, the reason that an individual is on ELMO and the geographic and demographic (race, ethnicity, age, sex) breakdowns of individuals on ELMO.
2. Records that include information on the operation and implementation of ELMO, including:
  a. Policy manuals or other guidance documents that address, mention, discuss, or implement (by name or in substance)  of 103 DOC 468 
       Electronic Monitoring Program,
  b. Guidance on how violations of ELMO terms/conditions are handled,
  c. Any documents or records that show the impact of ELMO term/condition violations (i.e. whether the individual re-incarcerated, etc),
  d.  Any documents or records that address which staff or unit(s) are responsible for monitoring participants in the DOC ELMO program,
  e.  Any documents, presentations, emails, or other records prepared by the Office of Investigative Services in relation to training staff slated 
  to work as a unit responsible for electronic monitoring,
  f.  The cost of ELMO GPS devices to individuals who are on ELMO, if any, and
  g.  Any memorandum of understanding or other records that define the relationship between DOC and Massachusetts Probation Service or 
   its ELMO vendors for the provision of people subject to ELMO in DOC custody, pre-release, or home confinement
3. An extract of your records management system that indicates line-level data of the number of individuals on ELMO who are under the DOC’s custody on pre-release, on home confinement, or otherwise from January 1, 2019 to the time when this request is answered. Specifically, we request the following fields in an excel or CSV format for all people who were on ELMO at any point at your agency during the above-mentioned time:
  a. The individual’s start date on ELMO
  b. The individual’s end date on ELMO 
  c. Reason/status of individual on ELMO (i.e. parole, pre-release, home confinement, etc.)
  d.Reason for individual being released from ELMO, if applicable
  e. County and Zip Code of individual
  f. Age of individual
  g. Gender of individual 
  h. Race of individual
  i. Ethnicity of individual 
  j. Underlying lead charge and/or offense for which the person was convicted
  k. Whether the person’s GPS conditions were allegedly violated, how many times such an alleged violation occurred, whether the violation was sustained, and what the outcome of said violation was, if applicable. 

This information does not require identified data or any personally identifying information of any person in the custody of the Department of Correction. This records request seeks only aggregate statistics, or non-identifying database extracts, and documents as outlined above.

With respect to the form of production, we note that relevant regulations require the production of records in an accessible, commonly used electronic form, to the extent feasible. See 950 CMR 32.04(5)(d). Record custodians are also required to implement new record keeping systems and databases in such a way as to allow for “retrieval of public portions of records to provide maximum public access.” See 950 CMR 32.07(1)(e). Extraction of such data from a database or electronic record system does not constitute creating a new record. See 950 CMR 32.07(1)(f). Printing these records from a database or electronic system, redacting them with a marker, and then re-scanning them, is generally not consistent with these regulations; this process provides the digital records neither in the preferred form nor in a “searchable machine-readable form.” 950 CMR 32.04(5)(d). If necessary, we welcome reasonable suggested modifications pursuant to 950 CMR 32.06(2)(g). Per Attorney Gen. v. Dist. Attorney for Plymouth Dist., 484 Mass. 260, 141 N.E.3d 429 (2020), compiling information from a database is not tantamount to creating a new record that would otherwise be precluded under public records law. Specifically: “Where public records are in electronic form, a public records request that requires a government entity to search its electronic database to extract requested data does not mean that the extracted data constitute the creation of a new record, which would not be required, under the public records law. " Id. at 442 to 443. Thus, we request that your department query its database and provide a response to the records request.

Should you determine that some portions of the documents are exempt from disclosure, please release any reasonably segregable portions that are not exempt. In addition, please note for any such redactions the applicable statutory exemption and explain why it applies to the redacted or withheld information.

I also request that fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by email attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff
Director of Strategic Initiatives
Erin Stewart
School to Prison Pipeline Project
Citizens for Juvenile Justice

With respect to the form of production, we note that relevant regulations require the production of records in an accessible, commonly used electronic form, to the extent feasible. See 950 CMR 32.04(5)(d). Record custodians are also required to implement new record keeping systems and databases in such a way as to allow for “retrieval of public portions of records to provide maximum public access.” See 950 CMR 32.07(1)(e). Extraction of such data from a database or electronic record system does not constitute creating a new record. See 950 CMR 32.07(1)(f). Printing these records from a database or electronic system, redacting them with a marker, and then re-scanning them, is generally not consistent with these regulations; this process provides the digital records neither in the preferred form nor in a “searchable machine-readable form.” 950 CMR 32.04(5)(d). If necessary, we welcome reasonable suggested modifications pursuant to 950 CMR 32.06(2)(g). Per Attorney Gen. v. Dist. Attorney for Plymouth Dist., 484 Mass. 260, 141 N.E.3d 429 (2020), compiling information from a database is not tantamount to creating a new record that would otherwise be precluded under public records law. Specifically: “Where public records are in electronic form, a public records request that requires a government entity to search its electronic database to extract requested data does not mean that the extracted data constitute the creation of a new record, which would not be required, under the public records law. " Id. at 442 to 443. Thus, we request that your department query its database and provide a response to the records request.

Should you determine that some portions of the documents are exempt from disclosure, please release any reasonably segregable portions that are not exempt. In addition, please note for any such redactions the applicable statutory exemption and explain why it applies to the redacted or withheld information.

I also request that fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by email attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff
Director of Strategic Initiatives
Erin Stewart
School to Prison Pipeline Project
Citizens for Juvenile Justice 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the MADOC Public Records Request Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1Ha0vjNDn7WUO8E9FekGukCsng0NW8A8dF3BR-2BgbpMI9ho48FSfpDIK5qcn8S1TuSuQ-3D-3DczND_hbb6Q-2FewTZQxFaRXYAe-2BXHpiDPfkLbG-2FZv2Y1I8fr8mXWtSX8TI0adRRJ0mK09zEiysmj7eIOv0cQdIx3fGib35l44AcKPiHSPsp9Wb4S6KLkaJCfh86Vw5qbv3uog2-2BTOw1mvHHXyqpkt1SgT-2B8aO2-2BqAVIeTHYv2kp0OEi2G1HVEHo2T0k3rIxPCldeVW6om9Bvy9OGx6Y3UM-2B8sHxuSdrLtkD-2FEcWPAyBuF1WvN56XnNzIlnI71MUfCSDbJ7wAv8pEsxUQRk-2BYac2oOByr0eZmhYTTpa9O-2FSksy-2Bg3-2B1wsRxkmIorB6zOwiohTt0euaAyaoD-2B8G9Uai-2FbB9o4ONu4Umn9tk7BZhCDp1HV5jMPPKsYf6kc9AV8OT2z-2BNdcs9ZBna3uCfJLvi0OltSuSQ-3D-3D)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Manuel de Dios Unanue
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Manuel de Dios Unanue (4 January 1943 – 11 March 1992) who was a Cuban-born US journalist, radio show host, anti-drug crusading editor of magazines Cambio XXI and Crimen, and editor-in-chief of El Diario La Prensa, New York City's largest Spanish-language daily newspaper.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously
    written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
    100,000
    readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
    People,
    Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
    expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
    established. In
    addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
    through
    non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock,
    disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
    this, a great
    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself.
    As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
    particular
    subject in advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information
    to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
    Inc. v. Dep’t of
    Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
    Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
    because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States
    foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
    qualify as a member of
    the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the
    requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made
    by” a
    representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
    reporter, for
    example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
    interest there is
    in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
    details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and
    making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records mentioning or describing Manuel de Dios Unanue (4 January 1943 – 11
    March 1992) who was a Cuban-born US journalist, radio show host, anti-drug
    crusading editor of magazines Cambio XXI and Crimen, and editor-in-chief of
    El Diario La Prensa, New York City's largest Spanish-language daily
    newspaper.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/81157/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/81157/Youth20Guilty20In20the20Slaying20Of20an20Editor20-20The20New20York20Times.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fmanuel-de-dios-unanue-88349%252F%253Femail%253Dfoipaquestions%252540ic.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1j4dJk%3AbiF5oIAYvBAIPbpZcBhFmFMgsjg

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] - RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Manuel de Dios Unanue
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

COVID-19 Impact: RIDS resumed full staffing on April 12, 2021.  Commensurate with the return of full staffing levels, RIDS will being increasing its FOIA processing production.  While RIDS will make its best efforts to meet increased production goals, this increased production rate may be negatively impacted by COVID-19 workplace disruptions.  As a result, estimated dates of completion for Freedom of Information Act requests were impacted and you can expect lengthened response timelines.  Please note that these are estimates, and these timelines may change as this national emergency evolves.  The FBI remains committed to fulfilling your FOIPA request in the timeliest manner possible.   Thank you for your patience and understanding.

You can renew the download files by logging into the efoia system and clicking
the "Renew" button in the file list.

title: Baker Act Records Request Re. Jupiter Police Department

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Baker Act Records Request Re. Jupiter Police Department
communications.communication:
Jupiter Pulice Department,

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- ALL records pertaining to the exercise of the baker act involving a Mason Craig Turner in Jupiter, FL. Within the Jurisdiction of Jupiter Police Department.
- Names of officers involved and statements and reports pertaining.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges post of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically. With the advancement of technology, records request such as this one do not require physical paper copies or an unusual amount of time to accommodate. If for some reason, there are fees associated with this request please send the invoice with the records.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days.

Sincerely,

Mason C. Turner
Chairman
United States Performance Products, Inc. (OTC:UPRM)
O:561-805-3591
M:561-805-3592

communications.subject: Records Request, Case #17-003743
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Mr. Turner:

The Town of Jupiter records section is in receipt of your request dated 12/28/21 (shown below).  I wanted to clarify one point before I fill the request.  If you want the full report without redactions, you would need to come in person to the police department records section with your photo ID, to pick up a copy of the report.  (for the New Year holiday, we will be closed tomorrow, Friday 12/31)  Otherwise, if we complete your request via email, be advised that the report would be redacted according to Florida Statutes Chapter 119.  Please let me know how you would like to proceed.
Thank you, and enjoy your day.

Terri Baz
Records Specialist
Jupiter Police Department
196 Military Trail
Jupiter, FL  33458

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Baker Act Records Request Re. Jupiter Police Department
communications.communication:
Ms. Terri,

Thank you for your professional and prompt response. The records being redacted as per Chapter 119 is not an issue. 


Thank you for your professionalism,

Mason C. Turner

Terri Baz
